SEARCH
Module org.example.pandaexpresspos
Package org.example.pandaexpresspos.database

Class DBDriverSingleton

java.lang.Object
org.example.pandaexpresspos.database.DBDriverSingleton
public class DBDriverSingleton extends Object
Singleton class that directly interacts with the PostgreSQL database via JDBC calls and converts results into data models. Because this class is a singleton, only one instance may exist throughout the entire application at any point in time.
Author:
Kevin Zhang

    • selectSalesByHour

      public List<Double> selectSalesByHour()
      Selects the sum of order prices grouped by hour. This only returns hours of the day up until the current hour, determined by Java's internal DateTime methods.
      Returns:
      a List<Double> of order price totals, grouped by hour. Index 0 corresponds to the 1st hour, etc.

    • selectOrdersByHour

      public List<Double> selectOrdersByHour()
      Selects the total number of orders grouped by hour. This only returns hours of the day up until the current hour, determined by Java's internal DateTime methods.
      Returns:
      a List<Double> of orders placed, grouped by hour. Index 0 corresponds to the 1st hour, etc.

    • selectSalesByHourForDay

      public List<Double> selectSalesByHourForDay()
      Selects the sum of order prices grouped by hour. This returns all hours of the day (1-12).
      Returns:
      a List<Double> of order price totals, grouped by hour. Index 0 corresponds to the 1st hour, etc.

    • selectOrdersByHourForDay

      public List<Double> selectOrdersByHourForDay()
      Selects the total number of orders placed grouped by hour. This returns all hours of the day (1-12).
      Returns:
      a List<Double> of order placed, grouped by hour. Index 0 corresponds to the 1st hour, etc.

    • selectSalesReport

      public Map<String,Integer> selectSalesReport(Integer startMonth, Integer endMonth, Integer startDay, Integer endDay)
      Totals up the number of times each menu item was included in an order in a specified time period
      Parameters:
      startMonth - the start month
      endMonth - the end month
      startDay - the start day
      endDay - the end day
      Returns:
      a Map<String, Integer>, where the keys are menu item names, and the values are the number of times the respective menu item was contained in an order

    • decreaseMenuItemInventoryQuantity

      public void decreaseMenuItemInventoryQuantity(MenuItem menuItem, int menuItemQty)
      Decreases the stock of inventory items associated with a given menu item
      Parameters:
      menuItem - the menu item to decrease the inventory stock for
      menuItemQty - the number of times the menu item was included in an order. For example, if we have 5 "Orange Chicken" in an order, we need to decrease its associated inventory stock 5 times

    • increaseMenuItemInventoryQuantity

      public void increaseMenuItemInventoryQuantity(MenuItem menuItem, int menuItemQty)
      Increases the stock of inventory items associated with a given menu item. This is primarily used to replenish stock after canceling an order.
      Parameters:
      menuItem - the menu item to increase the inventory stock for
      menuItemQty - the number of times the menu item was included in an order. For example, if we have 5 "Orange Chicken" in an order, we need to increase its associated inventory stock 5 times

    • selectProductUsage

      public Map<String,Integer> selectProductUsage(Integer startMonth, Integer endMonth, Integer startDay, Integer endDay)
      Totals up the number of times each inventory item was used over the specified time period
      Parameters:
      startMonth - the start month
      endMonth - the end month
      startDay - the start day
      endDay - the end day
      Returns:
      a Map<String, Integer>, where the keys are inventory item names, and the values are the number of times the respective inventory item was used
